decks.notes: This Bant Aggro deck focuses on efficiently casting powerful creatures and disrupting the opponent with countermagic and removal spells. By utilizing mana dorks like Noble Hierarch and disruptive cards like Daze and Force of Will, the deck aims to quickly get ahead on board and maintain pressure with threats like True-Name Nemesis and Stoneforge Mystic. Additionally, versatile creatures like Knight of the Reliquary provide utility and answers to opposing threats. The inclusion of equipment like Umezawa's Jitte and Swords of Plowshares enhance the deck's aggression and versatility. The deck also packs powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor to keep the pressure on the opponent.

The main concept of this Dredge deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with cards like Golgari Grave-Troll and Stinkweed Imp, allowing you to constantly dredge and put creatures like Narcomoeba and Ichorid onto the battlefield. With cards like Cabal Therapy and Faithless Looting, you can disrupt your opponent's strategy while setting up for powerful plays using cards like Dread Return. By utilizing cards like Bridge from Below and Lion's Eye Diamond, you can generate a strong board presence and overwhelm your opponent with a flurry of creatures.

The key concept of this Eldrazi Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with powerful Eldrazi creatures while disrupting their game plan with cards like Thorn of Amethyst and Chalice of the Void. The deck aims to quickly establish a board presence and apply pressure with creatures like Reality Smasher and Thought-Knot Seer, while also utilizing disruptive lands like Wasteland and City of Traitors. By combining aggressive creatures with disruptive elements, this deck aims to close out the game quickly and efficiently before the opponent can establish their own game plan.

This Grixis Aggro deck focuses on fast, aggressive plays to overwhelm the opponent. It utilizes a combination of efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets, Deathrite Shaman, and Young Pyromancer, along with disruptive spells like Force of Will and Daze to control the game. The deck also includes powerful draw spells like Brainstorm and Ponder to ensure consistent card advantage. With a mix of threats and answers, the deck aims to apply pressure quickly while disrupting the opponent's game plan, leading to a swift victory.

This deck focuses on using aggressive creatures like Young Pyromancer, Delver of Secrets, and Deathrite Shaman to quickly beat down the opponent. It also includes disruption spells like Cabal Therapy and Force of Will to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck utilizes cantrips such as Ponder and Gitaxian Probe to dig for threats and answers while keeping card advantage with Brainstorm. With a mana base that includes dual lands and Wastelands, the deck is able to consistently cast its spells and disrupt the opponent's mana base.

Utilizing a combination of strong creatures, disruptive spells, and versatile planeswalkers, this deck aims to control the board while applying pressure to the opponent. By efficiently managing resources and utilizing powerful card advantage engines such as Ancestral Vision and Shardless Agent, the deck seeks to outvalue and outpace the opponent. With a mix of hand disruption, removal, and powerful threats, it can adapt to various matchups and disrupt opposing game plans while establishing its own dominance. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the deck's multicolored spells and enable smooth gameplay.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan while deploying efficient threats to close out the game quickly. It utilizes a mix of disruptive spells like Force of Will, Hymn to Tourach, and Abrupt Decay to control the board, along with powerful creatures like Tarmogoyf and Shardless Agent to pressure the opponent. The deck aims to keep the opponent on the back foot through disruption and removal, while leveraging card advantage from cards like Ancestral Vision and Brainstorm to stay ahead in the game.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly generate mana using cards like Dark Ritual, Cabal Ritual, and Lion's Eye Diamond, while cycling through the deck with cards like Brainstorm, Ponder, and Preordain. The goal is to cast multiple spells in a single turn, building up to a powerful Tendrils of Agony or Ad Nauseam finish to deplete the opponent's life total in one explosive turn. The deck also includes disruption elements like Duress and Cabal Therapy to protect the combo and disrupt the opponent's game plan.

This deck focuses on controlling the game by using counterspells, removal spells, and card manipulation to disrupt the opponent's strategy. The key strategy is to utilize Counterbalance and Sensei's Divining Top to counter spells and keep the board clear of threats. The deck also includes powerful finishers like Entreat the Angels and Jace, the Mind Sculptor to close out the game. With a mix of control elements and card advantage, this UWx Control deck aims to outlast opponents and secure victory through careful decision-making and resource management.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game through card advantage and board manipulation. By using cards like Jace, the Mind Sculptor, Snapcaster Mage, and Monastery Mentor, the player can generate value and create threats while disrupting the opponent's game plan. The deck utilizes a combination of countermagic like Force of Will and Counterbalance, along with removal spells like Swords to Plowshares, to keep the opponent's threats in check. The inclusion of cards like Brainstorm, Ponder, and Sensei's Divining Top also ensures that the player has access to the right cards at the right time to maintain control of the game.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through counterspells, removal, and card advantage. It aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan by countering key spells, removing threats, and manipulating the top of its own library with cards like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Sensei's Divining Top. It also looks to generate card advantage with cards like Snapcaster Mage and Ponder. The win condition is either through setting up a large board presence with Monastery Mentor and Entreat the Angels, or by locking the opponent out of the game with Counterbalance and Sensei's Divining Top.

The key concept of this deck is to control the game through counter spells and removal while utilizing card advantage with cards like Sensei's Divining Top and Snapcaster Mage. The win condition is to stabilize the board with counterbalance and Terminus, then close out the game with powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and alternate win conditions like Entreat the Angels. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan and maintain control of the board until it can secure a victory.
